quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Ruth and Book
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, john, deaths. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: According to the Book of Matthew, how many disciples did Jesus give authority to heal the sick and drive out evil spirits?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 12

questions.question: In the Book of Ruth, what did Ruth do to indicate that she wanted to be redeemed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sleep at Boaz feet.

questions.question: In the Book of Ruth, who was Ruths mother-in-law that she would not abandon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Naomi

questions.question: According to the Book of Ruth, what did the kinsman-redeemer give to Boaz to indicate that Boaz would be the redeemer of Ruth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His sandal

questions.question: The Church of the Annunciation was built in Nazareth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In the Book of Ruth, Boaz was the closest relative thats why he came forward as the kinsman-redeemer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the Book of Ruth, after the deaths of Naomis husband and her two sons, Naomi wanted to leave Moab. Where did she go?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bethlehem

questions.question: Who was Ruths sister-in-law according to the Book of Ruth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Orpah

questions.question: Where did Ruth live when she met her first husband according to the Book of Ruth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moab

questions.question: Jesus was baptized by John the Baptist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who was king when Jesus was born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Herod

questions.question: Which of the apostles betrayed Jesus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Judas Iscariot

questions.question: According to the Book of Matthew, Jacob was the father of Issac.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Whose mother-in-law was lying in bed with a fever in the Book of Matthew?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peter

questions.question: In the Book of Matthew, what did Jesus say to the man with leprosy when he touched him?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Be Clean!

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Book and Books
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, title, proverbs. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which book of the Old Testament of the Bible has the least number of chapters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Obadiah

questions.question: The Book of Ruth comes after this book.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Judges

questions.question: Who was the first US President whose name appeared on the charter of a synagogue?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin Pierce

questions.question: What is the title of the last book of the Old Testament?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Malachi

questions.question: What was the name of Ruth and Boazs son in the Book of Ruth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Obed

questions.question: There are 32 chapters in the Book of Proverbs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which book of the Old Testament has the most chapters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Psalms

questions.question: Which of these books doesnt belong with the others?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jude

questions.question: The first two books in the Old Testament are Genesis and Exodus. What is the name of the third book?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leviticus

questions.question: Who was the  first Jew to serve as a  diplomat for the USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mordechai Noah

questions.question: Who was the first Jew to be offered a position on the US Supreme Court?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Judah Benjamin

questions.question: Finish the title of this book of the Old Testament: The Song of _____
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Solomon

questions.question: Which of these books of the Old Testament is not divided into parts I and II?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Numbers

questions.question: How many books are there in the Old Testament of the Bible?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 39

questions.question: Amos is the first book of the Old Testament alphabetically.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Book and Daniel
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, babylon, shadrach. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What king of Babylon took over Jerusalem in the first chapter of the Book of Daniel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nebuchadnezzar

questions.question: What kingdom do the legs of iron represent in King Nebuchadnezzars dream in the second chapter of the Book of Daniel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roman Empire

questions.question: Which successful Israeli General lost an eye and was famous for wearing an eye patch?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moshe Dayan

questions.question: What were the Hebrew names of Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego according to the Book of Daniel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hananiah, Mishael and Azariah

questions.question: Who was the first President of Israel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chaim Weizmann

questions.question: How many years did Golda Meir serve as President of Israel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 0

questions.question: In King Nebuchadnezzars dream from the second chapter of the Book of Daniel, what kingdom does the head of gold represent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Babylonian Empire

questions.question: What was the approximate Jewish population of the United States in 1790?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1300-1500

questions.question: Who was the  first Jew to serve as US Minister to The Hague?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: August Belmont

questions.question: According to the Book of Daniel, upon his arrival in Babylon, what was Daniels name changed to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Belteshazzar

questions.question: What does the term Chabad, as in Chabad Hasidism, mean?

options.text: Its the name of the place where this form of Hasidism began
Its the name of the first Chabad Rabbi.
It stands for wisdaom, understanding and knowledge.
It stands for healing the World.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It stands for wisdaom, understanding and knowledge.

questions.question: In the second chapter of the Book of Daniel, what did King Nebuchadnezzar have a dream about?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A statue

questions.question: This great American Army officer helped form the Israeli Army. He was responsible for organizing the army along modern lines and for leading the effort  to save Jerusalem in the 1948 war.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mickey Marcus

questions.question: During the Revolutionary War many Jews volunteered to fight the British and there was even a Jew Company. Where were the members of this company  from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charleston, S.C.

questions.question: Who was famous for saying We will fight the War [WWII] as if there were no White Paper and the White paper as if there were no war.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Ben-Gurion

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Period and Book
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, babylon, period. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the Book of Daniel, what would Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego not bow down to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An image of gold

questions.question: What does the number 613 refer to in Judaism?

options.text: The number of Israelites who went into Egypt to survive while famine plagued the Holy  Land
The number of commandments in the Torah
The number of Israelites who left Egypt with Moses
The days in a Jewish lunar year

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The number of commandments in the Torah

questions.question: What distinction does Frank Wolf hold?

options.text: He was the first  Jewish general in the US Army.
He was the first Jewish recipient of the Pulitzer Prize.
He was the first Jewish member of the House of Representatives.
He produced the first Yiddish play in then USA.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He produced the first Yiddish play in then USA.

questions.question: What was the name of the first union for actors in the US?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hebrew Actors Union

questions.question: What did Rose and Morris Michtom create in 1902?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Teddy Bear

questions.question: In the Book of Daniel, in King Nebuchadnezzars dream, the Greek Empire was represented by the chest and arms of silver.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Since they did not bow down, as King Nebuchadnezzar commanded, what happened to Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego in the Book of Daniel?

options.text: They were sent to the gallows.
They were thrown into a den of lions.
They were thrown into a fiery furnace.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They were thrown into a fiery furnace.

questions.question: Who was king of Babylon when Darius the Mede took over?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Belshazzar

questions.question: Which settlement is famous as the location of one of the most spectacular craters in Israel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mitzpeh Ramon

questions.question: What is Victor David Brenner remembered for?

options.text: He was the first Jewish mayor in the USA.
He painted the painting Washington Crossing the Delaware.
He was the first Jewish general in the US Army.
He made the portrait of Lincoln found on the US penny.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He made the portrait of Lincoln found on the US penny.

questions.question: What period was marked by the Great Jewish Revolt against the Roman Empire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 66-70

questions.question: Which organization was founded by Rabbi Ben Frankel in 1923?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hillel Foundation

questions.question: What distinction does Moses Alexander hold?

options.text: He was the first Jewish governor in the USA.
He was the first Jew to get an M.D. degree in the USA.
He was the first Jewish candidate for the American Presidency.
He was the first Jewish US Senator.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was the first Jewish governor in the USA.

questions.question: Who led the Jewish revolt against the Roman Empire in the period from 132 to 135?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bar Kochba and Rabbi Akiva

questions.question: In the Book of Daniel, what did King Darius decree would happen if anyone prayed to any god or person, except for him for a period of 30 days?

options.text: They would be thrown into the lions den.
They would be thrown into a fiery furnace.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They would be thrown into the lions den.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: City and Israel
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, parliament, understanding. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is strange about the edible vegetable Salicornia, which Israel exports to Europe?

options.text: It can only be eaten cooked.
The vegetable is also used in glass-making.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The vegetable is also used in glass-making.

questions.question: This man and his partner, Mort Shuman, wrote almost 1,500 songs. His writings include: Viva Las Vegas, Prisoner of Love, Sweets for My Sweets, This Magic Moment, and Suspicion.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Doc Pomus

questions.question: Which Israeli city is a sister city of New York City?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tel Aviv

questions.question: This Israeli city, which features many beautiful beaches and beautiful seashore views, is also the site of the first IKEA in Israel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Netanya

questions.question: An Israeli has invented a gun that can shoot around corners.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This Jewish woman is often considered the First Lady in Television  News.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dorothy Fuldheim

questions.question: Who is Gal Friedman?

options.text: He was the first Israeli UN Ambassador.
She was Israels first  Ambassador to the USA.
He was the first Israeli to win an Olympic gold  medal.
She was the first Israeli to win a Nobel Prize.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was the first Israeli to win an Olympic gold  medal.

questions.question: This great proponent for peace and understanding, who was Mayor of Jerusalem for 28 years, died in January , 2007.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teddy  Kollek

questions.question: You can go snow skiing in the area of which Israeli mountain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mt. Hermon

questions.question: Can an egg laid on a holy day (a Yom Tov) be eaten?

options.text: Rabbi Hillel says no, but Rabbi Shammai says yes.
Rabbi Hillel says yes, but  Rabbi Shammai says no.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rabbi Hillel says no, but Rabbi Shammai says yes.

questions.question: The Knesset is the Israeli parliament. In the Knesset building there is a tapestry by this famous artist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chagal

questions.question: Who was Ilon Ramon?

options.text: The first Israeli to win the Nobel Prize in Literature
The first Israeli tomplay in the NBA.
The first Israeli Ambassador to Egypt since Moses

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The first Israeli astronaut

questions.question: Which of these holidays does not have a fast associated with it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sukkot

questions.question: The circled-U symbol found on the labels of certain products shows that the Union of Orthodox Congregations have found the food is kosher. What was the first food product to have this symbol?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heinz ketchup

questions.question: What city is called The capital of the Negev (desert)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beer Sheva

quizzes.title: History Quiz: People and Line
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, festival, channukah. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the traditional food for Shavuot, a major festival in Judaism?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dairy products

questions.question: What meals are typically eaten during the celebrations of the Channukah holiday?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Potato pancakes and jelly doughnuts

questions.question: During Jewish wedding ceremonies, the bride and groom stay under a canopy. What is this canopy called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chupah

questions.question: What did these six people have in common: Roderigo De Trianna, Luis De Torres, Maestre Bernal, Alfonso De La Calle, Marco the Surgeon, and Roderigo Sanchez De Segovia?

options.text: They were the first Jews to be killed by the Spanish Inquisition.
They were the only Jews, or Muslims, who were allowed to remain in Spain after the Expulsion Notice of 1492 in order to attend to the health of King Ferdinand First.
They were Marranos who feigned to disavow Judaism so they could remain in Spain after the Expulsion Notice of 1492.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They all sailed with Columbus.

questions.question: Who is considered the father of the Jewish political movement and ideology of Zionism?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Theodor Herzl

questions.question: Jewish women often wear a piece of jewelry with the shape of human hand and sometimes writings on it. What is it called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hamsa

questions.question: Which line contains the correct names of the three Pilgrimage Festivals in Judaism?

options.text: Rosh Hashannah, Yom Kippur, and Channukah
Rosh Hashannah, Yom Kippur, and Sukkot

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sukkot, Passover, and Shavuot

questions.question: According to the Bible, David played this instrument to Israels first king, Saul.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harp

questions.question: According to the Bible, God commanded this prophet to anoint David as king.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Samuel

questions.question: The word Channukah, which refers to a Jewish tradition, means what in Hebrew?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dedication

questions.question: Jewish children are considered  grown up enough to be responsible for their actions at what age?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boys at 13, girls at 12

questions.question: Which of these people do Jews consider to be their historical religious Patriarchs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abraham, Issac, and Jacob

questions.question: In Jewish traditions, what is the ceremony for the naming of a female baby on the evening of her fifth day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Eve of the Sixth

questions.question: Which line represents the correct beginning of the Shema prayer?

options.text: Hear, O Israel! Bless the Lord who gave us the Torah!
Hear, O Israel! The Lord is our God! The Lord is One!
Blessed be the name of the glory of His kingdom!
Blessed be the name of the Lord who made our bread!

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hear, O Israel! The Lord is our God! The Lord is One!

questions.question: What is the meaning of the Hebrew toast lChaim!?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To life!
